history.content:
A lot of people take these together - it's a pretty common courseload. I did these last semester with another tech and spent maybe ~8 hours a week on 61b and ~6-8 hours a week on 70. (10-12 hours for 61b on prjoect/midterm weeks, like 15ish for 70 near exams.) 61b will probably be a lot more time consuming next spring because (afaik) hilfinger is slated to teach it. 70 depends wildly on the person; depending on how fast you learn the material and whether you choose the no-homework option, it could take as few as 3 and as many as 20+ hours a week.

Also, 70 is a very important class for building mathematical background and preparing you for that side of the department, but I don't really think it helps with tech interviews at all (outside of preparing you for 170, which does help to an extent.)

children.subject: I'm taking that combo rn and this comment feels about right.
The numbers given above seem very low to me. 70 was more like 20-30 hours a week for me (including homework, discussion, lecture watching) and 61b with Hilfinger was similar

history.content:
How manageable would cs61b and cs70 be (taken concurrently)? What is the weekly time commitment like for each of these classes? 

I want to take 61A,61B, and 70 as soon as possible because I know these are the most important classes for technical interviews/internships.
history.subject: CS61B and CS70 workload
